intro: Psychotria ararum, commonly known as the Ayahuasca vine, is a tropical plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, green leaves and clusters of white or yellow flowers. The plant contains psychoactive alkaloids, including DMT, which contribute to its traditional use in shamanic rituals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Its botanical significance lies in its role in both ecological systems and cultural practices.
